intro: Eucalyptus jacobsiana, commonly known as the Jacobs' mallee, is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its smooth, peeling bark and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hair. The plant produces small, globular flower clusters that are typically pale or creamy white in color. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance and fire resistance. Eucalyptus jacobsiana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
